etymologies: Middle English: shortening of Old Northern French escren, of Germanic origin

definitions: a fixed or movable upright partition used to divide a room, give shelter from draughts, heat, or light, or to provide concealment or privacy

examples.text: the Special Branch man remained hidden behind the screen for prosecution witnesses
a room with a red carpet and screens with oriental decorations

shortDefinitions: fixed or movable upright partition used to divide room, give shelter from draughts, heat, or light

definitions: a thing providing concealment or protection

examples.text: his jeep was discreetly parked behind a screen of trees
the article is using science as a screen for unexamined prejudice

shortDefinitions: thing providing concealment or protection

definitions: a partition of carved wood or stone separating the nave of a church from the chancel, choir, or sanctuary

examples.text: the chancel screen retains two sections of the original oak arcading

shortDefinitions: partition of carved wood or stone separating nave of church

definitions: a windscreen of a motor vehicle

examples.text: a branch whipped across the screen and tore off one of the wipers

shortDefinitions: windscreen of motor vehicle

definitions: a frame with fine wire netting used in a window or doorway to keep out mosquitoes and other flying insects

examples.text: gauze screens fitted to the doors and windows were tightly closed

shortDefinitions: frame with fine wire netting used in window or doorway

definitions: a part of an electrical or other instrument which protects it from or prevents it causing electromagnetic interference.
shortDefinitions: part of electrical or other instrument which protects it from or prevents it causing electromagnetic interference

definitions: a grid placed between the control grid and the anode of a valve to reduce the capacitance between these electrodes.
shortDefinitions: grid placed between control grid and anode of valve

definitions: (in basketball, American football, and ice hockey) an act of obstructing or blocking an opponent or their view of play.
shortDefinitions: act of blocking defensive player

definitions: a flat panel or area on an electronic device such as a television, computer, or smartphone, on which images and data are displayed

examples.text: a television screen
a computer screen
a giant video screen

shortDefinitions: panel or area on electronic device on which images and data are displayed

definitions: a blank surface on which a film or photographic image is projected

examples.text: two historical swashbucklers are due to fill cinema screens this year
a huge movie screen

shortDefinitions: blank surface on which photographic image is projected

definitions: films or television as a medium, genre, or industry

examples.text: she's a star of the track as well as the screen
he is interviewed on screen

shortDefinitions: films or television

definitions: the data or images displayed on a computer screen

examples.text: pressing the F1 key at any time will display a help screen

shortDefinitions: data or images displayed on computer screen

definitions: a flat piece of ground glass on which the image formed by a camera lens is focused.
shortDefinitions: flat piece of ground glass on which image formed by camera lens is focused

definitions: a transparent finely ruled plate or film used in half-tone reproduction.
shortDefinitions: transparent finely ruled plate or film used in half-tone reproduction

definitions: a system of checking a person or thing for the presence or absence of something, typically a disease

examples.text: services offered by the centre include a health screen for people who have just joined the company

shortDefinitions: system of checking person or thing for presence or absence of something

definitions: a detachment of troops or ships detailed to cover the movements of the main body

examples.text: HMS Prince Leopold and HMS Prince Charles sailed for Shetland with a screen of four destroyers

shortDefinitions: detachment of troops or ships detailed to cover movements of main body

definitions: a large sieve or riddle, especially one for sorting substances such as grain or coal into different sizes

examples.text: the material retained on each sieve screen is weighed in turn

shortDefinitions: large sieve

definitions: conceal, protect, or shelter (someone or something) with a screen or something forming a screen

examples.text: her hair swung across to screen her face
a high hedge screened all of the front from passers-by

shortDefinitions: conceal, protect, or shelter person or thing with screen

definitions: separate something from something else with or as if with a screen

examples.text: an area had been screened off as a waiting room

shortDefinitions: separate something from something else with or as if with screen

definitions: protect (someone) from something dangerous or unpleasant

examples.text: in my country a man of my rank would be screened completely from any risk of attack

shortDefinitions: protect someone from something dangerous or unpleasant

definitions: prevent from causing or protect from electromagnetic interference

examples.text: ensure that your microphone leads are properly screened from hum pickup

shortDefinitions: prevent from causing or protect from electromagnetic interference

definitions: (in basketball, American football, and ice hockey) obstruct or block (an opponent or their view of play).
shortDefinitions: obstruct opponent

definitions: show (a film or video) or broadcast (a television programme)

examples.text: the show is to be screened by the BBC later this year

shortDefinitions: show film or video or broadcast

definitions: test (a person or substance) for the presence or absence of a disease

examples.text: outpatients were screened for cervical cancer

shortDefinitions: test person or substance for presence or absence of disease

definitions: check on or investigate (someone), typically to ascertain whether they are suitable for or can be trusted in a particular situation or job

examples.text: all prospective presidential candidates would have to be screened by a preselection committee

shortDefinitions: check on or investigate someone

definitions: evaluate or analyse (something) for its suitability for a particular purpose or application

examples.text: only one per cent of rainforest plants have been screened for medical use

shortDefinitions: evaluate or analyse something for its suitability for particular purpose or application

definitions: exclude someone or something after evaluation or investigation

examples.text: anti-spam software can screen out large amounts of unwanted email

shortDefinitions: exclude person or thing after evaluation or investigation

definitions: pass (a substance such as grain or coal) through a large sieve or screen, especially so as to sort it into different sizes

examples.text: granulated asphalt—manufactured to 40 mm down or screened to 28 mm & 14 mm down

shortDefinitions: pass substance through large sieve or screen

definitions: project (a photograph or other image) through a transparent ruled plate so as to be able to reproduce it as a half-tone.
shortDefinitions: project photograph or other image through transparent ruled plate so as to be able to reproduce it as half-tone
